Yesterday, I voted in support several bills that will focus much-needed resources and attention to the mental well-being of our veterans.
These bipartisan bills, which passed unanimously in the House, will expand VA mental health and suicide prevention services.

NY was the epicenter of the women's suffrage w/pioneers like Elizabeth Cady Stanton and Susan B. Anthony leading the charge. NYS granted women the right to vote, in 1917 & the following year, Huntington suffragist, Ida Bunce Sammis was the 1st woman elected to the NYS Assembly pic.twitter.com/DEQ800grAp
I am proud to be serving in the 116th Congress, with the highest number of women ever elected to the House.

1) Lower the price of prescription drugs, with additional actions to make it easier to bring generics to market;

2) Crackdown on junk plans – which discriminate against people with pre-existing conditions and do not cover essential benefits; and

3) Reverse the Admin's dangerous health care sabotage by helping states to set up their own marketplaces so they can expand cov & lower costs, reinforcing the Navigator program that helps families enroll in affordable coverage & restoring funding for enrollment education efforts.

We must lower prescription drug costs, protect people with pre-existing conditions, and stop the administration from sabotaging the Affordable Care Act.

I am a proud co-sponsor of HR 9, the Climate Action Now Act, which will prohibit the US from spending any money towards backing out on our commitment.
America cannot & will not retreat from our promise to help address climate change.

#ClimateActionNow
The US made a commitment to the world that we would reduce our contributions to greenhouse gases as part of the Paris Accord.
The US set its own goals. Now, the current administration has said we will pull out at the earliest possible date...November 2020.
